Two oncotypes were performed a score of 25 on the core biopsy , a score of only 3 , yes only 3 on the surgical specimen from the lumpectomy and a high Risk Mammaprint result. I did 4 rounds of TC. Crazy to read that your tumor grew 1 cm in only a month. I was misdiagnosed during a previous pregnancy with breast cyst and I thought it was a misdiagnosis. Maybe indeed the cancer started after the first pregnancy , it was 2.5 cm tumor just like yours.

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2014 05:56AM - edited Jan 10, 2014 05:15PM by Srh242 Yes , the cells are microtumors ( cts or circulating tumor cells) .They cannot be detected by scan until they reach I think 1 mm tumor( not sure have to check) . Please checknthis website cancerfree-areyousure.com and RCG lab in Greece website, that can explain more. When you have a 2mm tumor you already have ctcs or microtumors in your blood, that is why this staging system is obsolete. Most of us are stage 4 at diagnosis, when a tumor cant be seen in a scan yet. Very sad.
